items.summary:
Implement an application-level superuser/admin capability in the backend so the requesting user can obtain full permissions and access across the chat app.

- Add a backend mechanism to let the first authenticated user to claim it become the app superuser (admin), and expose a query to check whether the caller is currently an admin.
- Update backend authorization checks so admins can perform privileged operations across the app (i.e., admins are not blocked by normal ownership/member-only restrictions where applicable), while non-admin behavior remains unchanged.
- All backend error messages surfaced to the UI must be in English (no traps with unclear text).

Add a frontend UI in Settings to let the signed-in user view and obtain admin access, and clearly communicate the current admin status.

- Add an “Admin access” section to the existing Settings dialog.
- Show the current status (e.g., “You are an admin” / “You are not an admin”).
- Provide a button to claim admin access (only succeeds if no admin exists yet), with English success/error toasts.
- If the user is an admin, show a subtle “Admin” indicator in the authenticated header area (English label).

Add a basic “Search in chat” feature for both room chat and server chat views.

- Provide a search input that filters the currently loaded messages in the active thread (room messages and server announcements) by text content.
- The filtering must be client-side (no new backend indexing requirement).
- Use English placeholder/labels (e.g., “Search messages…”), and show an English empty-state when no matches are found.
